intro: Balaneikon wrightii, commonly known as the Wright's balaneikon, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbel-like inflorescence. The plant features finely divided, aromatic leaves and small white or greenish flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
